content.text: Information Retrieval is not just about algorithms; it is about how humans interact with those algorithms to find meaning. HCI in IR focuses on making search intuitive and effective.
content.hook: The best search engine is invisible. You ask, and you find.

content.text: Traditional IR focused on system performance (P/R). Modern IR focuses on user satisfaction. HCI studies the 'Gulf of Execution' (how to search) and the 'Gulf of Evaluation' (interpreting the results).

formula.description: Fitts's Law predicts the time (T) required to move to a target (like a search button), helping designers optimize button size and placement for faster search interactions.

content.text: 1. Informative Feedback (Show what the system is doing), 2. Error Prevention (Autocomplete), 3. User Control (Allowing query refinement), 4. Consistency.
